meanings.definition: To make something less valuable or of lower quality.
meanings.sent1: She cheapened the antique vase by accidentally dropping it.
meanings.sent2: The knockoff designer handbag cheapened her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The magician cheapened the illusion by revealing the trick too soon.
meanings.sent4: His constant lies cheapened his reputation in the eyes of others.
meanings.sent5: The fake gold paint cheapened the look of the statue, making it appear less valuable.

meanings.definition: To reduce the cost or price of something.
meanings.sent1: The store cheapened the price of the shoes during the clearance sale.
meanings.sent2: The company cheapened their products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer jokingly cheapened the bidding war by pretending to fall asleep.
meanings.sent4: The discount code cheapened the overall shopping experience for the customers.
meanings.sent5: The Black Friday deals cheapened the value of the items in the eyes of the consumers.
